name: Why Does the Ocean Sing
descHash:
Waves surge forth, their roar echoing across the heavens.
Fish swim through the empty seas, where ancient foam churns and that melody seems to still linger.

"Noble Princess, feast with us!"
Answering the deep sea's call, she danced with the black tide until she alone remained on that grand stage.

"Swordmaster of the seas, why do you stay silent, what makes you sing?"
With every step upon the Earth, she endured the pain, rarely singing, only her crimson blade sang the lament of life.

"Dux Gladiorum, come with me to conquer the starry seas!"
When she found this blazing light, she finally took up her bow, believing it to be the start of the celebration.

...

"Helektra... Helektra... when your song ends, where will you swim to next?"

When futile hopes shatter, she always answers their questions with a solitary melody, yet it enchants all who hear it.

Or perhaps... whether in the mortal realm or the deep sea, the only true listener is the performer herself.

29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

589818.name: Starfire Essence
589818.desc: A mature heliobus that ran away after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces moderately for Nihility characters.
589818.lore:
A mean and nasty heliobus that appears like a full flame.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. This torch-like heliobus has just tasted consciousness and is eager to devour its host's emotions and desires.

"Absorb their emotions and sway their wills..."

673759.name: Heaven Incinerator
673759.desc: A beast-form heliobus that homogenized after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces significantly for Nihility characters.
673759.lore:
An intelligent and powerful heliobus that has started to take the form of a beast.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. A large heliobus, having homogenized its numerous lesser peers, will gradually have a stable shape. These immortal beings can become so dangerous that they are considered calamities.

"Floods, fires, landslides, and thunderstorms..."

694487.name: Refined Aether
694487.desc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides <nobr>6000</nobr> Light Cone EXP.
694487.lore:
A canister of aether that has been extracted and distilled using special procedures.

"The Garden looks forward to recreating a past glory, but it is a 'past glory' selected by them. Do you understand?"

694488.name: Condensed Aether
694488.desc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides <nobr>2000</nobr> Light Cone EXP.
694488.lore:
A can of Aether refined through special techniques.

"Handle with care, do not drop or place pressure upon it. If damages and leaks occur, please refer to chapter II of the Leak Disaster Response Manual for emergency response."

694489.name: Sparse Aether
694489.desc: Enhancement material for Light Cones, provides <nobr>500</nobr> Light Cone EXP.
694489.lore:
An imaginary substance that shouldn't exist in reality. The basic material to create Light Cones.
The images contained in the Light Cones become clearer when infused with this substance.

"I see, so this is the supposed 'memoria' of the Garden of Recollection. No wonder the Memokeepers can set off on galactic voyages with memories."

874345.name: Fiery Spirit
874345.desc: Feeble heliobus that scattered after the Flaming Catastrophe War. Used to level up Traces slightly for Nihility characters.
874345.lore:
An innocent, formless heliobus.
The size of a heliobus's flame when it materializes indicates its strength. This little heliobus is innocent and naive and may be easily consumed by more powerful heliobi.

"Formless, rootless, and roaming boundless..."

20170864.name: Courage-Torn Chest
20170864.desc: A fragment of the Strife Titankins after their demise. Normal material used for enhancement.
20170864.lore:
The slothful generals began to drill, and the reclusive sages began to plot. Then humanity discovered they could shatter the creations of gods, and slaughter became war.

"Fear is the chisel of courage."
comeFrom: Titankin at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Crepuscular Beasts at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher

20389475.name: Glory-Aspersed Torso
20389475.desc: The heart of a Strife Titankin, full of divine power. Advanced material used for enhancement.
20389475.lore:
In the beginning, humanity fought wars to stay alive, but now some fight as fearlessly as the Titankins of Strife to achieve death. The Kremnoans say that perhaps warriors of flesh and stone share the same heart —

"And this heart is called glory, with courage flowing within."
comeFrom: Titankin at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Crepuscular Beasts at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher

20445700.name: Fear-Stomped Flesh
20445700.desc: Dust that forms the Strife Titankins. Crude material used for enhancement.
20445700.lore:
The tide of death sweeps across the world, and giants of hatred and resentment step forth from the River of Souls. All fear and cower before that stone-carved legion.

"Slaughter is the stone from which fear is hewn."

skill.name: Solo
skill.descHash: Increases the wearer's Effect Hit Rate by #1[i]%. When an enemy target gets inflicted with a debuff by the wearer, there is a #2[i]% base chance for them to enter "Enthrallment," lasting for #3[i] turn(s). Effects of the same type cannot stack. While the target is in "Enthrallment," for every 1 debuff applied by the wearer on the target, increases the target's received DoT by #4[f1]%, stacking up to #5[i] time(s). When the target gets attacked by an ally, increases the attacker's SPD by #6[f1]% for #7[i] turn(s). When the wearer gets knocked down, removes all "Enthrallment."
